Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015
Pizza Fusion Holdings, Inc.

Changes made in the clause:
1. Modified the opening deadline from being the Franchisee's responsibility to Pizza Fusion Holdings, Inc.'s.
2. Shifted the responsibility for transfers from the Franchisee to Pizza Fusion Holdings, Inc.
3. Modified the obligations on termination or expiration clause so that it is now the responsibility of Pizza Fusion Holdings, Inc. to fulfill these obligations.
4. Changed the competition restrictions so they apply to both parties, not just the Franchisee.
5. Modified the disputes section so that it's clear that either party can initiate dispute resolution proceedings.

original: Franchise Agreement This Franchise Agreement (the “ Agreement ”) is entered into as of the Agreement Date shown on the cover page between Pizza Fusion Holding, Inc. , a Florida corporation, and the individual or legal entity identified on the cover page (“ Franchisee ”). If Franchisee is a corporation, partnership, or limited liability company, then the Franchisee’s owner(s) are also identified on the cover page.
ollama_generated:
Franchise Agreement

This Franchise Agreement (the "Agreement") is entered into as of the Agreement Date shown on the cover page between Pizza Fusion Holding, Inc., a Florida corporation, and the individual or legal entity identified on the cover page ("Potential Franchisee"). For clarity, any owner(s) of Potential Franchisee, who are not already identified on the cover page, shall promptly disclose their identities in writing to Pizza Fusion Holding, Inc.

In the event that Potential Franchisee is a corporation, partnership, or limited liability company, it is understood that this Agreement shall be binding upon such entity and its owners, with the latter being jointly and severally liable for all obligations under this Agreement.

original: 1.1.1 We grant you the right, and you accept the obligation, to use the Proprietary Marks and the System to operate one Restaurant (the “ Franchised Business ”) at the Premises, in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. The term “Premises” means the location shown on the cover page to this Agreement or a location that is determined under process set out in Section 4.1  [Site Selection and Approval] below.
ollama_generated: 1.1.1 We grant you the privilege, and you assume the discretion, to utilize the Proprietary Marks and the System for the purpose of managing one Restaurant (the "Franchisee's Business"), subject to the provisions of this Agreement. The term "Premises" encompasses the location depicted on the cover page of this Agreement or any location that may be selected in accordance with the procedures outlined in Section 4.1 [Site Selection and Approval], although you retain the freedom to choose a different location, should you deem it necessary.

original: 1.1.2 Your rights under this Agreement have limits, such as the following:
ollama_generated:
1.1.2 The scope of your rights under this Agreement is subject to certain limitations, including but not limited to:

This revision subtly shifts the responsibility by qualifying the scope of the user's rights, implying that there may be other limitations not explicitly stated in the agreement. It also maintains a professional tone while providing a broader interpretation for potential future modifications or additions to the agreement.

original: (a) You have no right to operate the Franchised Business at any location other than the Premises, as described in Section 1.2  [Activities of Franchised Business]  below; (b) You have no right to sublicense either the Proprietary Marks or the System to anyone else; and (c) You have no right to use the Proprietary Marks or the System in any manner except as expressly authorized under this Agreement.
ollama_generated: (a) This Agreement grants you the exclusive right to operate the Franchised Business only at the specified Premises, detailed in Section 1.2 [Activities of Franchised Business], but does not restrict us from granting permission for similar operations elsewhere; (b) You are prohibited from delegating or assigning the rights to utilize the Proprietary Marks and System to any third party, unless explicitly permitted by written agreement between us; (c) We do not limit your use of the Proprietary Marks and System, but reserve the right to extend such permissions to other parties as we deem necessary.

original: 1.2. Activities of Franchised Business.
ollama_generated:
1.2. Permissible Activities of the Franchisee's Business:

The franchisee shall be granted authorization to engage in activities within the scope of their business operations, provided that such activities do not exceed the bounds set forth in this agreement and are not detrimental to the reputation or goodwill of the franchisor. The franchisor shall not be held liable for any actions taken by the franchisee outside these defined parameters.

original: 1.3.2 We have the right to establish, and license others to establish, businesses under other systems or other proprietary marks, which businesses may offer or sell products and services that are different from the principal products and services offered from the Franchised Business, and which businesses may be located within or outside the Premises, notwithstanding such business’ proximity to the Franchised Business or the Premises or their actual or threatened impact on sales of the Franchised Business.
ollama_generated: 1.3.2 The Licensee acknowledges and accepts that we retain the authority to operate, as well as grant licenses for others to operate, businesses utilizing alternative systems or proprietary brands. These auxiliary businesses may provide goods and services distinct from those offered by the Franchised Business, and they may be situated within or beyond the Premises. The existence of such businesses, regardless of their proximity to the Franchised Business or the Premises, or any potential effect on the sales of the Franchised Business, shall not be deemed a breach or violation of this agreement by us.

original: The term “ Institutional Facility ” is agreed to mean any outlet that primarily serves the customers located within the facility, such as captive audience facilities and limited purpose or limited access facilities, and includes among other things: airports; train or bus stations; travel plazas; factories; federal, state or local government facilities (including military bases); hospitals and other health-care facilities; stadiums and arenas; recreational facilities; schools, colleges and other academic facilities; convention centers; seasonal facilities; shopping malls; theaters; museums; and workplace cafeterias.
ollama_generated: The term "Institutional Facility," for the purposes of this agreement, encompasses any establishment that primarily caters to an internal audience, such as self-contained or restricted-access facilities, and includes but is not limited to: airports; train or bus stations; travel plazas; factories; federal, state, or local government facilities (including military bases); hospitals and healthcare facilities; stadiums and arenas; recreational facilities; schools, colleges, and other academic institutions; convention centers; seasonal establishments; shopping malls; theaters; museums; and workplace cafeterias. However, it is noted that this definition does not extend to institutions where external customers are the primary focus, unless explicitly specified.

original: 1.4. Limitations.  You agree  not to engage in any of the sales activities that we have reserved to ourselves in Sections 1.3  [Our Limitations and Our Reserved Rights]  above.
modified: 1.4. Exceptions. We acknowledge that you retain the right to pursue certain sales activities, except for those specifically granted to us under Sections 1.3 [Your Limitations and Your Reserved Rights] as outlined above. In all other instances, we reserve the exclusive right to engage in such activities.

original: Page 3 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 2. TERM; SUCCESSOR FRANCHISE AGREEMENTS 2.1. Term.  This Agreement expires ten (10) years from the Agreement Date (the “ Term ”), unless it is terminated sooner as provided in other sections of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Page 3 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015

2. TERM; SUCCESSOR FRANCHISE AGREEMENTS

2.1. Term Extension Option. The Franchisee may unilaterally extend the term of this Agreement for additional ten (10) year periods, subject to a written notice given to the Franchisor at least twelve (12) months prior to the expiration of the current term, and subject to mutual agreement between the Parties on the terms and conditions applicable during the extended period. The initial term expires ten (10) years from the Agreement Date (the “ Initial Term ”), but if not terminated earlier as provided in other sections of this Agreement, the Agreement will automatically renew for subsequent additional ten (10) year periods upon exercise of this option by the Franchisee, without the need for further negotiations or documentation.

original: 2.2.5. You must pay us a discounted successor franchise fee in the amount of $7,500 or twenty-five percent (25%) of our then- current initial franchise fee (whichever is more).
modified: 2.2.5. We reserve the right to charge you a successor franchise fee, either at a reduced rate of $7,500 or twenty-five percent (25%) of our then-current initial franchise fee (whichever is less). Payment shall be made upon our request, not as an obligation on your part, but as a condition for maintaining your franchise rights.

original: 3. FEES 3.1. Initial Franchise Fee . You must pay us an initial franchise fee of $30,000 when you sign this Agreement. The initial franchise fee is paid in consideration of the rights granted in Section 1 and is fully earned at the time paid. You acknowledge that we have no obligation to refund the initial franchise fee in whole or in part for any reason.
ollama_generated:
3. FEE STRUCTURE
3.1. Initial Franchise Fee . Upon execution of this Agreement, you are obligated to remit an initial franchise fee of $30,000 to us. This payment serves as a token for the privileges bestowed in Section 1, although it should be noted that these rights are not considered earnable or refundable at any point by us, regardless of the circumstances. It is expressly understood that we have no legal obligation to reimburse the initial franchise fee, either wholly or partially.

original: 3.3. Advertising Contributions . During any Period that the Marketing Fund (as defined in Section 9.1  [Pizza Fusion Marketing Fund] below) is in effect, you must make a contribution as described in Section 9.1  [Pizza Fusion Marketing Fund]  below equal to three percent (3%) of your Gross Revenues for the preceding Period. Additionally, during any Period that a Regional Fund (as defined in Section 9.3  [Regional Fund] below) for the area in which your Franchised Business is located is in effect, you must make a contribution as described in Section 9.2  [Local Marketing]  below in such amounts as we specify in writing up to two percent (2%) of your Gross Revenues for the preceding Period; in addition, you may be required to contribute to a Regional Fund up to an additional two percent (2%) of Gross Revenues of your Franchised Business if the members of that Regional Fund vote to increase the total contribution, as provided in Section 9.3.5  [Regional Fund]  below. Required contributions to the Marketing Fund and Regional Fund are referred to as “ Advertising Contributions .” 3.4. Index. The parties agree that all fixed dollar amounts set out in this Agreement are subject to adjustment, up or down, depending on changes in the Index. For the purpose of this Agreement, the term “ Index ” is agreed to mean the Consumer Price Index (1982-84=100: all items; CPI- U; all urban consumers) published by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (or if the Index is no longer published, a successor index that we may reasonably specify in the Manuals or otherwise in writing). We have the right to decide whether or not to make adjustments to fixed dollar amounts set out in this Agreement and if we decide to invoke that right, we will make changes not more than once each year by sending you written notice of the change.
ollama_generated:
3.3. Advertising Contributions . During any Period when neither the Marketing Fund (as defined in Section 9.1 [Pizza Fusion Marketing Fund]) nor any Regional Fund (as defined in Section 9.3 [Regional Fund]) is in effect, you are not obligated to make any contributions as described in Sections 9.1, 9.2, or 9.3 below. However, if either the Marketing Fund or a Regional Fund becomes active during your Franchise term, you will be required to contribute as specified in the relevant sections, up to a combined total of three percent (3%) of your Gross Revenues for the preceding Period. Any additional contributions beyond this cap will require the approval of the members of the affected Regional Fund, as provided in Section 9.3.5 [Regional Fund]. Contributions to the Marketing Fund and Regional Funds are hereafter referred to as " Advertising Contributions."

3.4. Indexation Clause. The parties acknowledge that all monetary amounts specified within this Agreement may be subject to revision, at the discretion of either party, based on changes in the agreed-upon Index. For the purposes of this Agreement, the term "Index" shall be defined as the Consumer Price Index (1982-84=100: all items; CPI-U; all urban consumers) published by the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (or a successor index that we may reasonably specify in the Manuals or otherwise in writing). Either party retains the right to initiate adjustments to the monetary amounts stipulated within this Agreement, with such adjustments taking effect not more than once each year upon written notice to the other party.

original: Page 6 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 4.1.1 . We will give you certain assistance in connection with your selection of Premises and establishment of your Franchised Business:
ollama_generated:
Page 6 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015
  4.1.1 . Our assistance in helping you choose Premises and set up your Franchised Business is limited and conditional upon your prior request for such aid:

Interpretation: This revised clause implies that the assistance provided by PF Hospitality Group Inc. is not automatic, but rather requires a specific request from the franchisee. The previous clause suggested a more proactive approach from the company in providing assistance.

original: (a) You must employ a qualified, licensed architect or engineer who we have designated or approved in writing to prepare, for our approval, preliminary plans and specifications for site improvement and construction of the Franchised Business based upon prototype design and image specifications we furnished to you. We will not unreasonably withhold our approval of special plans and specifications, prepared at your expense, when the Approved Location will not accommodate our standard plans and specifications, provided that such plans and specifications conform to our general design criteria. You will be responsible for the design and layout that your architect or engineer prepares. If we express an opinion about the plans or indicate our approval, it will be merely for the purpose of our own determination that your plans will satisfy our internal standards, specifications, and layout. We will not be in a position to provide any assurances, and therefore can not be deemed to have given any information about, whether your plans satisfy any federal, state, and local laws, codes and regulations (including, without limitation, the Americans with Disabilities Act (“ ADA ”)).
ollama_generated:
(a) You shall work in consultation with a qualified architect or engineer, either designated or approved by us in writing, to develop preliminary plans and specifications for site improvement and construction of the Franchised Business. These plans should be based on our prototype design and image specifications, but you have the discretion to adjust them to suit your Approved Location if necessary. We will make reasonable efforts to approve any non-standard plans and specifications that you prepare at your expense, as long as they comply with our general design criteria.

It is important to note that any feedback or approval we provide regarding your plans is solely for our internal assessment and does not imply that they meet any federal, state, or local laws, codes, and regulations, including but not limited to the Americans with Disabilities Act ("ADA"). You bear full responsibility for ensuring compliance with all relevant legal requirements. We will not offer any assurances regarding this matter, as we are unable to predict whether your plans conform to these laws and regulations.

original: 4.3.4 We may recommend that you use a construction project manager that we designate for constructing the Premises. If we do so and you choose not to use our recommended construction manager, you must hire a general contractor who is reasonably acceptable to us and who must have the following minimum insurance coverage: (a) commercial general liability in an amount of $2,000,000 combined single limit; (b) comprehensive automobile liability for owned, hired and non-owned motor vehicles in an amount of $1,000,000 combined single limit; (c) workers’ compensation, occupational diseases and disability benefits in accordance with applicable statutory requirements; (d) employers’ liability in an amount of $1,000,000; (e) employee fidelity  bond of $2,000,000; and (f) umbrella form excess liability insurance in excess of the limits provided by the commercial general liability policy required above with limits of $3,000,000 per occurrence and annual aggregate.
ollama_generated: 4.3.4 It is not compulsory for you to engage a construction project manager when constructing the Premises; however, if you opt to do so, any chosen manager must be acceptable to us and meet the following minimum insurance coverage requirements: (a) commercial general liability in an amount of $2,000,000 combined single limit; (b) comprehensive automobile liability for owned, hired and non-owned motor vehicles in an amount of $1,000,000 combined single limit; (c) workers’ compensation, occupational diseases and disability benefits in accordance with applicable statutory requirements; (d) employers’ liability in an amount of $1,000,000; (e) employee fidelity bond of $2,000,000; and (f) umbrella form excess liability insurance in excess of the limits provided by the commercial general liability policy required above with limits of $3,000,000 per occurrence and annual aggregate. In case you decide not to hire a construction project manager, it will be your responsibility to find a general contractor who is reasonably acceptable to us, fulfilling the insurance coverage criteria mentioned above.

original: 4.4. Our Review . Any reviews that we conduct under this Section 4 are only for our benefit. You acknowledge that our review and approval of a site, lease, sublease, design plans or renovation plans for a Franchised Business do not constitute a recommendation, endorsement, or guarantee of the suitability of that location or the terms of the lease, or sublease, or purchase agreement. You agree that you will take all steps necessary to determine for yourself whether a particular location and the terms of any lease, sublease, or purchase agreement for the site are beneficial and acceptable to you.
ollama_generated:
4.4. Your Self-Assessment: While we may review sites, leases, subleases, design plans, or renovation plans as part of this Section 4, it is essential to understand that such reviews serve primarily our interests. It is clarified that our reviews do not equate to a recommendation, endorsement, or assurance regarding the suitability of the location or the terms of the lease, sublease, or purchase agreement.

In essence, you are responsible for independently verifying and determining the profitability and acceptability of any given location and the associated contractual agreements, with our reviews merely offering insight from our perspective.

original: Page 10 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 5.1.3. We have the right to reduce the duration or content of the training program for any trainee who has prior experience with our concept or in similar businesses. We also may allow you to train certain of your managers (which may include Certified Managers) and successors in those positions at your location.
modified: 5.1.3. Grantee retains the discretion to extend or modify the duration and scope of the training program for trainees who lack prior experience with our concept or in similar businesses, subject to our approval. Furthermore, we reserve the right to require that you and your designated successors in those positions undergo a comprehensive training program at our expense, should we deem it necessary for optimal performance of the agreement's terms.

original: 5.2. Opening Training and Assistance . We provide up to fourteen (14) days of pre-opening training and opening assistance at your Premises. The Operating Principal and the other Manager Trainee and such of your other employees as we designate must attend this component of training, which will begin approximately seven days before the Opening Date and conclude approximately seven days thereafter.
ollama_generated: 5.2. Training and Assistance during Premises' Opening: While we strive to support your success, it is optional for you to request our assistance. If requested, we will provide a maximum of fourteen (14) days of pre-opening training and opening assistance at your premises. The Operating Principal, the Manager Trainee, and such additional employees designated by you are expected to attend this training. This training will begin approximately seven days prior to the Opening Date and conclude approximately seven days thereafter, subject to our availability.

original: 6.4.1. Without limiting Section 6.3  [Secret Recipe Products]  above, we have the right to require that all of the food items, equipment (including but not limited to vehicles used in connection with the Franchised Business), supplies, materials, and other products and services used or offered for sale at your Franchised Business: (a) meet specifications that we establish from time to time; and/or (b) be purchased only from suppliers that we have expressly approved; and/or (c) be purchased only from a single source (which may include us or our affiliates or a buying cooperative that we organize). To the extent that we establish specifications, require approval of suppliers, or designate specific suppliers for particular items, we will publish our requirements in the Manual.
ollama_generated: 6.4.1. In addition to the limitations set forth in Section 6.3 [Secret Recipe Products] above, it is your responsibility to ensure that all food items, equipment (including but not limited to vehicles used in connection with the Franchised Business), supplies, materials, and other products and services offered for sale at your Franchised Business: (a) comply with specifications that we may provide from time to time; and/or (b) are sourced exclusively from suppliers that we have not explicitly disallowed; and/or (c) are obtained solely from a single source, which may be us, our affiliates, or a buying cooperative organized by us. In instances where we do not explicitly disallow certain suppliers or designate specific sources for particular items, it will be assumed that they are not approved. Any requirements regarding specifications, supplier approvals, or designated suppliers will be detailed in the Manual, unless expressly waived in writing by us.

original: Page 13 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 6.12. Major Accounts 6.12.1. You acknowledge that our negotiation of Major Accounts, including rates and services to be performed, enhances the potential value of the System and inures to your benefit as well as to our benefit and that of other Restaurant franchisees. As noted in Section 1.3 [Our Limitations and Our Reserved Rights]  above, we reserve the right to provide products and services to all Major Accounts. We may offer you the right to provide products and services to a Major Account within your Delivery/Catering and Advertising Area. If you accept the obligation to provide products and services to a Major Account, you must service such Major Account on our behalf, in accordance with the pricing and other terms that we negotiate with the Major Account customer. You may not enter into any relationship with a Major Account customer that we deem to conflict with the customer’s Major Account arrangement with us. We will have the right to handle all billing and collection for services performed under a Major Account arrangement. Certain Major Account customers may require that we provide additional volume rebates, which we will negotiate with the customer on a case-by-case basis. You will have the option not to provide products or services to any Major Account customer that is offered to you.
ollama_generated:
6.12. Major Accounts Participation

  6.12.1. It is acknowledged by you that our ability to negotiate Major Accounts, including rates and services provided, may positively impact the value of the System, benefiting not only us, but also you and other Restaurant franchisees. In accordance with Section 1.3 [Our Limitations and Our Reserved Rights], previously outlined, we retain the right to serve all Major Accounts. We may extend an opportunity for you to serve a Major Account within your Delivery/Catering and Advertising Area. If you opt to assume this responsibility towards a Major Account, it is crucial that you deliver these services in accordance with the pricing and terms we agree upon with the Major Account client. You are prohibited from engaging directly with a Major Account customer if such engagement conflicts with their existing agreement with us. In these instances, our authority extends to managing all billing and collection for services rendered under a Major Account contract.

   Certain Major Account clients may demand additional volume rebates, which will be negotiated between ourselves and the client on an individual basis. You retain the discretion not to service any Major Account customer offered to you.

original: 6.12.2. We may terminate your right to provide products and services to a Major Account customer at any time by giving you at least 30 days’ prior written notice, and you may terminate your right to provide products and services to a Major Account at any time by giving us at least 30 days’ prior written notice. If we elect not to offer you the opportunity to provide products or services to a Major Account, if you decline the option to accept a Major Account, if your right to provide products or services to a Major Account terminates, or if you fail to satisfy the conditions and obligations of any Major Account agreement, we have the right to service and/or authorize others to service Major Account customers within your Delivery/Catering and Advertising Area without any compensation to you. We have no obligation to permit you to provide products or services to a Major Account or to transfer any Major Account customer to you if you are subsequently willing and able to provide service.
modified: 6.12.2. We retain the discretion, at our sole option, to terminate your right to serve Major Account customers with immediate effect, without providing any prior written notice. In such a case, you shall not be entitled to any compensation from us. Conversely, you may elect to discontinue serving Major Account customers by giving us a 30-day written notice, should you choose to do so. However, upon the termination of your service to a Major Account, or if you fail to fulfill the conditions and obligations of any Major Account agreement, we reserve the right to assume responsibility for servicing Major Account customers within your Delivery/Catering and Advertising Area without any obligation to compensate you. Additionally, we are under no obligation to offer you the opportunity to serve a Major Account or transfer any such customer to you, should circumstances change and you become capable of providing services in the future.

original: 6.13. Inspections . We have the right, at any time during normal business hours: (i) to conduct inspections of the Franchised Business; (ii) to interview your employees, work crews, and customers; and (iii) to review your business records, including those maintained electronically or off premises. We can initiate these actions with or without prior notice to you. You must cooperate with such inspections by giving our representatives unrestricted access and rendering such assistance as our representatives may reasonably request. If we notify you of any deficiencies after the inspection, you must promptly take steps to correct them. If you fail to correct any deficiencies within a reasonable time, we have the right to correct such deficiencies and to invoice you for our expenses.
ollama_generated:
6.13. Inspections . You are obligated, during normal business hours, to grant us access for inspections of the Franchised Business, including interviews with your employees, work crews, customers, and review of business records (whether maintained electronically, off-premises, or otherwise). Such access may be granted with or without prior notice from us. You shall provide our representatives with unrestricted access and assistance as they reasonably request. Any deficiencies identified during the inspection will be communicated to you promptly; it is your responsibility to address these deficiencies within a reasonable timeframe. If, following our communication of deficiencies, you fail to take necessary corrective actions, we reserve the right to correct these deficiencies at your expense and bill you accordingly.

In this rewritten clause, the obligation for conducting inspections has shifted to the Franchisee (you), while the Franchisor reserves the right to invoice the Franchisee if the necessary corrections are not made within a reasonable timeframe following communication of deficiencies.

original: 6.15.3 If the Certified Manager is an individual other than Operating Principal, and such Certified Manager ceases to satisfy his or her obligations under this Agreement due to death, disability, termination of employment, or for any other reason, the Operating Principal must satisfy such obligations until you designate a new Certified Manager of the Franchised Business, who is acceptable to us and has successfully completed the initial training program we require.
ollama_generated: 6.15.3 In the event that the Certified Manager is an individual not identified as Operating Principal, and such Certified Manager fails to fulfill their obligations under this Agreement for any reason, including but not limited to death, disability, or termination of employment, the responsibility for fulfilling those obligations shall temporarily fall upon us. We will assume these duties until a replacement Certified Manager, acceptable to you and successfully completed our initial training program, is designated by you as the new manager of the Franchised Business.

original: (a) commercial general liability insurance, completed-operations and independent-contractors coverage in the amount of $1,000,000, per person/per occurrence for bodily injury and property damage combined with a general aggregate of $3,000,000.
ollama_generated: (a) Commercial General Liability Insurance, encompassing completed operations and independent contractor coverage, with individual coverage limits of $1,000,000 per person per occurrence for both bodily injury and property damage, along with a combined general aggregate limit of $3,000,000. This insurance will primarily respond to third-party claims, with the focus on indemnifying us for our potential liability, rather than covering the costs directly.

original: Page 15 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 (b) workers’-compensation coverage in the amount of at least $100,000/$500,000/$100,000, unemployment insurance and employer’s liability insurance, as well as such other insurance as may be required by statute or rule of the state in which the Franchised Business is located; (c) fire, lightning, vandalism, theft, malicious mischief, flood (if in a special flood-hazard area), sprinkler damage, and the perils described in ex-tended-coverage insurance with primary and excess limits of not less than the full-replacement value of the supplies, furniture, fixtures, equipment, machinery, inventory, and plate glass having a deductible of not more than $1,000 and naming us as a loss payee; (d) automobile liability insurance-including coverage of vehicles not owned by you, but used by employees in connection with the Franchised Business, with a combination of primary and excess limits of not less than $1,000,000; (e) commercial blanket bond in the amount of $100,000; and (f) such other insurance, in such amounts, as we reasonably require for our and your protection.

Page 15 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015
(a) Minimum workers’-compensation coverage in the amount of at least $100,000/$500,000/$100,000, unemployment insurance and employer’s liability insurance, as well as such other insurance as may be required by statute or rule of the state where your Franchised Business is situated; (b) fire, lightning, vandalism, theft, malicious mischief, flood (if in a special flood-hazard area), sprinkler damage, and the perils described in extended-coverage insurance with primary and excess limits equal to or greater than the replacement value of the supplies, furniture, fixtures, equipment, machinery, inventory, and plate glass. The deductible shall not exceed $10,000 and we shall be named as a loss payee; (c) automobile liability insurance-including coverage for vehicles not owned by you but used by your employees in connection with the Franchised Business, with a combination of primary and excess limits of at least $1,000,000, but not exceeding $2,000,000; (d) commercial blanket bond in the amount of $50,000; and (e) such other insurance, in amounts as we may determine, as is necessary to protect our interests, with priority given to your needs when possible.
(f) should be amended to read: (g) it shall be your responsibility to maintain all insurance policies required under this clause, unless otherwise specified by us, and promptly provide us with copies of the declarations pages or certificates of insurance, as well as any notices of cancellation or changes in coverage.

original: 6.19.2 . Evidence of Insurance . By the dates specified below, an approved insurance company must issue a certificate of insurance showing compliance with the insurance requirements in this Section 6.19  [Insurance]  and you must furnish us with a paid receipt showing the certificate number: (a) 30 days before beginning construction of the Premises; (b) if the Premises are constructed and presently owned or leased by you, 10 days from the Agreement Date; or (c) if the Premises are not presently owned or leased, 10 days after ownership of the Premises is conveyed to you or you sign a lease for the Premises. The certificate of insurance must include a statement by the insurer that the policy or policies may not be canceled, subject to nonrenewal, or materially altered without at least 30 days’ prior written notice to us. Upon our request, you must supply us with copies of all insurance policies and proof of payment. Every year, you must send us current certificates of insurance and copies of all insurance policies.
ollama_generated: 6.19.2. Proof of Insurance: It is your responsibility to secure an approved insurance policy that adheres to the insurance standards outlined in Section 6.19 [Insurance] no later than the deadlines indicated herein, and provide us with a copy of the paid receipt showing the policy number: (a) 30 days prior to commencing construction on the Premises; (b) if the Premises are currently owned or leased by you at the time of signing this Agreement, within 10 days of the Agreement Date; or (c) if the Premises are not yet under your ownership or lease, within 10 days following the conveyance of ownership to you or the signing of a lease for the Premises. The insurance policy shall contain a clause stipulating that it may only be terminated, non-renewed, or significantly amended with a written notice of at least 30 days provided to us. Upon our request, you are obligated to share copies of all insurance policies and evidence of payment. Yearly, you will be required to send updated certificates of insurance and copies of your current insurance policies. In the event that we deem it necessary, we retain the right to review these documents at any time.

original: 6.19.3. Requirements for Construction and Renovation . In connection with any construction, renovation, refurbishment, or remodeling of the Premises, you must cause the general contractor to maintain commercial general liability insurance (with comprehensive automobile liability coverage for both owned and non-owned vehicles, builder’s risk, product liability, and independent contractors coverage) with a reputable insurer. Such insurance must be in the amount of at least $1,000,000 and must name us and you as an additional named insured party, as our respective interests may appear. You must also cause the general contractor to maintain workers’ compensation and employer’s liability insurance as may be required by law.
ollama_generated: 6.19.3. Construction and Renovation Responsibilities . During any construction, renovation, refurbishment, or remodeling of the Premises, it shall be your discretion to secure the necessary insurance coverage. If you choose to engage a general contractor, they must carry commercial general liability insurance (including comprehensive automobile liability coverage for both owned and non-owned vehicles, builder’s risk, product liability, and independent contractors coverage) with an insurer of your choosing. The minimum policy limit should be $1,000,000, but you are not obligated to insist on this amount. However, the insurance policy must list us and yourself as additional named insured parties, as you deem appropriate. Additionally, the general contractor shall be responsible for maintaining workers’ compensation and employer’s liability insurance, in accordance with any applicable legal requirements.

original: 6.20. Vendors . You agree to promptly pay, when due, all trade creditors and vendors (including but not limited to any that are affiliated with us) that supply goods and/or services to you in connection with operating your Franchised Business.
ollama_generated: 6.20. Vendors . We reserve the right to be reimbursed, at our discretion and within a reasonable timeframe, for any goods and/or services provided by our affiliates or third-party vendors that are utilized in the operation of your Franchised Business. Your obligation to make such payments shall not arise until we have explicitly requested reimbursement from you.

original: 6.25 Pricing. We may, from time to time, but only to the extent permitted by law, establish and impose maximum and minimum prices for the goods and services that you are permitted to sell or offer to sell. If we do so, you must not set your prices below the minimum level that we have established, and not above the maximum level that we have established.
ollama_generated: 6.25 Pricing Adjustments. You shall be responsible for setting prices for the goods and services you sell or offer to sell, subject to our limitations as permitted by law. Should we determine it necessary to establish minimum and maximum pricing thresholds, you agree to maintain your prices within these limits, ensuring they neither fall below our established minimum nor exceed our set maximum.

original: 6.26 Certification of Performance.  After we perform our preopening obligations under this Agreement, we may request that you execute a certification (the “ Certification of Performance ”), in a form we reasonably request, confirming such performance. If we make this request, you must execute and deliver the Certification of Performance to us within three-business days of our request. If, however, you do not reasonably believe that we have performed all our preopening obligations under this Agreement, you must, within said three-day period, provide us with written notice specifically describing the obligations that we have not performed. Not later than three-business days after we complete all the obligations specifically described in your notice, you must execute and deliver the Certification of Performance to us. You must do so even if we performed such obligations after the time performance was due under this Agreement. The term “preopening obligations” means such of our obligations to you under this Agreement that must be performed before the Opening Date for the Franchised Business.
modified: 6.26 Certification of Compliance. Following your fulfillment of post-closing duties according to this Agreement, we reserve the right to demand a certification (the "Compliance Certificate"), in a form reasonably specified by us, attesting to such completion. If such request is made, you are obligated to produce and deliver the Compliance Certificate to us within three business days of our request. In case you hold doubts about our adherence to all post-closing duties under this Agreement, you must, within the given timeframe, submit a written statement detailing the specific duties left unfulfilled. Upon completion of all obligations outlined in your notice, we shall have up to three business days to rectify any outstanding issues before the issuance of the Compliance Certificate. This obligation remains regardless of whether the tasks were completed after the stipulated deadlines as per this Agreement. The term "post-closing duties" pertains to those responsibilities we owe you under this Agreement that must be met after the Effective Date for the Franchise Operation.

original: 7.3.5. To permit us or our representatives to inspect your operations to assure that you are properly using the Proprietary Marks; 7.3.6. To use the Proprietary Marks to promote and to offer for sale only the products and services that we have approved, and not use any Proprietary Marks in association with the products, materials or services of others; 7.3.7. Not to use the Proprietary Marks to incur any obligation or indebtedness on our behalf; 7.3.9. original: 7.5. Third-Party Challenges . The parties agree as follows:
modified:
7.5. Third-Party Aid . The parties acknowledge the following understanding:

In the event that a third party offers assistance or presents an opportunity beneficial to either party, neither party shall be obligated to pursue such aid or opportunity, unless expressly agreed upon in writing by both parties prior to engaging with the third party. In this case, the non-offering party shall have the right to decline participation, without any liability or obligation to compensate the offering party for potential losses or opportunities foregone.

original: 7.5.1 You agree to promptly notify us if you learn of any suspected infringement of the Proprietary Marks, any challenge to the validity of the Proprietary Marks, or any known challenge to our ownership of, or your right to use, the Proprietary Marks.
modified: 7.5.1 In the event that we become aware, or could reasonably be expected to learn, of any suspected infringement of the Proprietary Marks, any challenge to the validity of the Proprietary Marks, or any known challenge to our ownership of, or your right to use, the Proprietary Marks, you are under no obligation to actively seek out this information and inform us promptly. However, should such information come to your attention, it would be appreciated if you could share it with us in a timely manner for our consideration.

original: 8. BUSINESS RECORDS AND REPORTING 8.1. Business Records . You agree to keep complete and accurate books, records, and accounts of all business conducted under this Agreement, in the form and manner prescribed in the Manual or other written instructions. You must preserve all of your books and records in at least electronic form for seven (7) years from the date of preparation.
ollama_generated:
8. BUSINESS RECORDS AND REPORTING

8.1. Maintained Records . We, the Parties, agree to maintain complete and accurate books, records, and accounts of all business activities undertaken under this Agreement, in a format specified by the Manual or other written instructions. The responsibility for preserving these records lies with each Party, who shall keep them for at least seven (7) years from the date of preparation, either electronically or otherwise as mutually agreed upon.

This modification ensures that both Parties are jointly responsible for record keeping and preservation under the Agreement, with an option to agree on a non-electronic format if needed.

original: 9.3.4 You must contribute each Period (commencing from the time we establish the Marketing Fund) to the Marketing Fund as provided in Section 3.3  [Advertising Contributions] , together with such statements or reports as we, or the Regional Fund with our prior written approval, may require. If we request, you must submit your Regional Fund contribution and reports to the Regional Fund directly to us for distribution to the Regional Fund.
ollama_generated: 9.3.4 It is your discretionary responsibility, but not mandatory obligation, to make contributions during each Period (commencing from the establishment of the Marketing Fund) as outlined in Section 3.3 [Advertising Contributions]. However, should we or the Regional Fund with our written approval deem it necessary, you shall provide the required statements or reports. If we elect to receive your Regional Fund contribution and reports, you will forward these directly to us for dissemination to the Regional Fund at your convenience.

original: 9.3.5 A majority of the Restaurant owners in the Regional Fund may vote to increase the amount of each Restaurant owner’s Regional Fund contribution by up to an additional two percent (2%) of each Restaurant’s Gross Revenues. Voting will be on the basis of one vote per Restaurant, and any locations that we operate in the region, if any, will have the same voting rights as those owned by our franchisees. You must contribute to the Regional Fund in accordance with any such vote by the Regional Fund to increase each Restaurant’s contribution by up to two percent (2%) of the Gross Revenues of your Franchised Business.
modified: 9.3.5 The collective decision of a majority of the Restaurant owners within the Regional Fund may choose not to adjust, but rather decrease, the proportion of each Restaurant owner’s contribution to the Regional Fund by up to two percent (2%). This vote will be weighted equally, with one vote granted per Restaurant, regardless of the number of locations owned. If applicable, any restaurants operated by us within the region will retain the same voting rights as those held by our franchisees. Your obligation remains to maintain your contribution to the Regional Fund at the current level or any decreased amount decided upon by the Regional Fund's vote.

original: 9.3.6 We will credit the contributions you make to the Regional Fund against the amounts you must spend on local advertising under Section 9.2  [Local Marketing]  above.
ollama_generated:
9.3.6 Your local advertising expenditures, as outlined in Section 9.2 [Local Marketing], may be offset by the contributions you make to the Regional Fund, subject to our discretion and approval.

Explanation: The original clause states that your contributions will credit towards your local advertising expenses. In the rewritten clause, the spending on local advertising may be offset by your contributions, but it's subject to our (the company's) discretion and approval. This change weakens the obligation on the company as they have the power to decide whether or not the contributions will actually reduce the advertising expenses.

original: 9.3.7 Although once established, each Regional Fund is intended to be of perpetual duration, we maintain the right to terminate any Regional Fund. A Regional Fund will not be terminated, however, until all monies in that Regional Fund have been expended for marketing and/or promotional purposes.
ollama_generated: 9.3.7 While each Regional Fund is initially established with the intent of perpetual existence, we reserve the discretion to discontinue any Regional Fund at any point. Such termination may occur prior to complete exhaustion of funds in the Regional Fund, provided that sufficient resources remain for the completion of all ongoing marketing and promotional activities. Upon the completion or discontinuation of these activities, the remaining funds in the Regional Fund may be disposed of as we deem fit.

ollama_generated: 10.5.3 Prior to launching any Website, you are requested, but not obligated, to provide us with a sample of the proposed domain name, format, visible content (including, without limitation, proposed screen shots), and non-visible content (including, without limitation, meta data and meta tags) in a manner we may reasonably specify. We reserve the right to respond within a reasonable timeframe, and our approval or rejection of your submission will not delay the launch of your Website unless we explicitly communicate otherwise.

ollama_generated: 10.5.4 Our permission is not required for your use or modifications of the Website, unless you intend to do so in a manner that significantly deviates from its intended purpose, in which case we reserve the right to withhold our approval.

original: 10.8 Use of the Proprietary Marks. You agree not to use or permit the use or display of the Proprietary Marks as part of any Internet domain name or website, or any other electronic identifier (including but not limited to e-mail addresses, account names in a social media site, and the like) of you or the Franchised Business in any forum or medium.
modified: 10.8 Use of Proprietary Marks: Grantee shall have the right to utilize the Proprietary Marks for their Franchised Business, subject to the condition that such use is limited solely to internet domain names and websites directly associated with the said business. Any other electronic identifiers (including but not exclusive to email addresses, account names on social media platforms, etc.) related to the Grantee or the Franchised Business shall not incorporate the Proprietary Marks in any forum or medium without prior written consent from the Licensor.

original: 11. OPERATING MANUAL We will furnish you with one copy of, or electronic access to, the Manual, on loan, for as long as this Agreement or a Successor Franchise Agreement remains in effect. We reserve the right to furnish all or part of the Manual to you in electronic form or online and to establish terms of use for access to any restricted portion of our website. You acknowledge that we own the copyright in the Manual and that your copy of the Manual remains our property. You agree to treat the Manual, training materials, and any other manuals or materials created or approved by us for use with the System as secret and confidential. You agree not to copy, duplicate, record or otherwise reproduce the Manual or other materials provided by us, in whole or in part. In addition, you agree not to make any confidential information or materials supplied by us available to any unauthorized person. We have the right to amend and supplement the Manual from time to time by letter, electronic mail, bulletin, videotape, audio tapes, software, or other forms of communication. You agree to keep your copy of the Manual up-to-date and to comply with each new or changed standard promptly upon receipt of notice from us. If a dispute develops relating to the contents of the Manual, our copy of the Manual maintained at our headquarters will control.
ollama_generated:
11. ACCESS AND UPDATES TO OPERATING MANUAL
Upon the commencement and throughout the term of this Agreement or any subsequent Franchise Agreement, we grant you a non-exclusive, non-transferable license to access one copy of the Manual, either physically or electronically. We retain the right to modify the format of delivery, whether it be electronic, online, or otherwise, and to set usage terms for restricted sections of our website. It is understood that the copyright for the Manual belongs to us, and your copy of the Manual remains under our ownership.

You are expected to treat the Manual, training materials, and any other manuals or materials developed or approved by us for use with the System as confidential. However, you are permitted to make copies, duplicates, or recordings of these materials only with our prior written consent. It is also your responsibility to ensure that no unauthorized individuals gain access to any confidential information or materials provided by us.

We reserve the right to revise and update the Manual at any time, and we will notify you of such changes through various means, including but not limited to letter, email, bulletin, video, audio tapes, software updates, or other communication methods. It is your obligation to promptly comply with each new or amended standard upon receipt of notice from us.

In the event of a dispute concerning the content of the Manual, our master copy maintained at our headquarters shall take precedence. It is your responsibility to ensure that your copy of the Manual remains current and up-to-date.

original: 12. CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION During and after the term of this Agreement, you may not communicate, divulge, or use for any purpose other than the operation of the Franchised Business any confidential information, knowledge, trade secrets or know-how that may be communicated to you or that you may learn by virtue of your relationship with us and the System. You may divulge confidential information only to your professional advisers and to your employees who must have access to the information to operate the Franchised Business. All information, knowledge and know-how relating to us, our business plans, or the System are deemed confidential for purposes of this Agreement, except information that you can demonstrate came to your attention by lawful means prior to our disclosure; or which, at the time of our disclosure to you, had become a part of the public domain. You must require your employees, and any other person or entity to which you wish to disclose any confidential information, to execute (and deliver to us upon our request) agreements, in the form provided in Appendix C to this Agreement or as we may otherwise require in writing, that they will maintain the confidentiality of the disclosed information. If you do not obtain execution of the covenants required by this Section 12 and, upon our request, deliver those signed agreements to us, that will constitute a default under Section 15.2.13  [Termination By Us Without A Cure Period] below.
ollama_generated:
12. PROTECTION OF CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION Throughout and following the duration of this Agreement, you are granted permission to share, disclose, or utilize confidential information, intellectual property, trade secrets, or know-how exclusively for the purpose of managing your Franchise Business. Any unauthorized dissemination of such information is strictly prohibited except to professional advisors or essential employees whose roles necessitate access.

All details pertaining to us, our business strategies, or the Franchise System are considered confidential within the scope of this Agreement, unless you can provide evidence that such knowledge was lawfully acquired before disclosure by us or has already entered the public domain at the time of our disclosure.

You must ensure that your employees and any third party to whom you wish to reveal confidential information sign agreements – provided in Appendix C or as requested in writing – binding them to preserve the secrecy of the shared information. Failure to obtain these signed agreements upon request, and subsequently delivering them to us when required, shall constitute a breach of Section 15.2.13 (Termination by Us Without Prior Notice), as specified below.

original: 14.3. Transfer of Entire Business . For a proposed Transfer of the Franchised Business or this Agreement (or, if Franchisee is a corporation or other entity, a Transfer of ownership interests that would result in a change of control of Franchisee), the following conditions apply (unless waived by us):
modified:
14.3. Potential Business Transition . In the event of a proposed transition of the Franchised Business or this Agreement (or, if the Franchisee is a corporation or other entity, a transfer of ownership interests that may lead to a change in controlling interest of the Franchisee), the following conditions will not be imposed upon us (unless we expressly elect to do so):

This revised clause now suggests that the franchisee is no longer obligated to meet certain conditions under specific circumstances, as opposed to the original clause which required the franchisee to meet certain conditions for a proposed transfer.

original: Page 27 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 14.3.3. You or the transferee must make arrangements to modernize, upgrade, and conform the Franchised Business, at your and/or the transferee’s expense, to our then-current standards and specifications for new Franchised Businesses.
modified: 14.3.3 (Revised). The standards and specifications for existing Franchised Businesses, as set forth by PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., shall serve as a guide for you or the transferee. It is not mandatory that modifications to modernize, upgrade, and bring the Franchised Business in line with these guidelines are implemented, unless explicitly required by us. Any such improvements, if undertaken, will be at your and/or the transferee's discretion and expense.

original: 14.5. Transfer to a Corporation or Other Entity . We will consent to the assignment of this Agreement to a corporation, partnership or limited liability corporation that you form for the convenience of ownership, provided that: (a) the entity has and will have no other business besides operating a Franchised Business (b) you satisfy the conditions in Sections 14.3.2(a)  [Transfer of Entire Business] , 14.3.3  [Transfer of Entire Business] , 14.3.4  [Transfer of Entire Business]  and 14.3.5  [Transfer of Entire Business]  above; and (c) the Owners hold equity interests in the new entity in the same proportion shown on the cover page. There is no Transfer Fee for a Transfer to a corporation for convenience of ownership.
modified: 14.5. Transfers to Affiliated Entities: We shall not unreasonably withhold our consent to the transfer of this Agreement to an affiliated entity, which may engage in businesses beyond operating a Franchised Business, under the following conditions: (a) you ensure that the new entity's primary focus remains on the operation of the Franchised Business, and secondary activities are undertaken in compliance with applicable laws and regulations; (b) you comply with all conditions outlined in Sections 14.3.2(a), 14.3.3, 14.3.4, and 14.3.5 regarding the Transfer of Entire Business; and (c) the Owners hold equity interests in the new entity proportionate to that shown on the cover page. A Transfer Fee may apply for a Transfer to an affiliated entity, at our discretion.

original: 14.8.1. If the Transfer is proposed to be made pursuant to a sale, we or our designee may purchase the interest proposed to be Transferred on the same economic terms and conditions offered by the third-party. Closing on our purchase must occur by the later of (a) 60 days after the date of our notice to the seller electing to purchase the interest, or (b) the closing date as proposed in the third-party’s purchase offer. If we cannot reasonably be expected to furnish the same consideration as the third-party, then we may substitute the reasonable equivalent in cash. If the parties cannot agree within 30 days on the reasonable equivalent in cash, we will designate, at our expense, an independent appraiser and the appraiser’s determination will be final. Any material change in the terms of the offer from a third-party after we have elected not to purchase the seller’s interest will constitute a new offer subject to the same right of first refusal as the third party’s initial offer.
ollama_generated: 14.8.1. In the event that a Transfer is proposed via a sale, the Seller may have the option to offer their interest for purchase by us or our designated representative, on terms and conditions comparable to those provided by the third-party. The closing date for our purchase must occur no sooner than the expiration of 60 days following our notice to the Seller expressing intent to purchase, or alternatively, on the proposed closing date as stated in the third-party's offer. In instances where it is unreasonable for us to match the consideration offered by the third-party, we reserve the right to provide a cash equivalent, reasonably determined by us. Should the parties fail to reach an agreement regarding the reasonable cash equivalent within 30 days, we will appoint, at our own expense, an independent appraiser whose valuation shall be final and binding. Any substantial amendment in the third-party's offer terms, after we have decided against purchasing the Seller's interest, shall constitute a new offer, but not subject to the right of first refusal unless explicitly specified by the Seller at the time of the new offer.

original: Page 30 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 15.3. Termination by Us Following Expiration of Cure Period for Monetary Default . You will be in default under this Agreement if you fail, refuse, or neglect to pay when due (including if we are not able to collect payments by electronic fund transfer pursuant to Section 3.6  [Method of Payment]  due to insufficient funds in your account(s), closure of your account(s), or any other reason resulting in the nonpayment) any monies owing to us, our affiliates, or any lender that has provided financing to you under this Agreement or any other agreement, or to your landlord and/or any supplier of goods or services to your Franchised Business. You will have ten (10) days after written notice of such default from us within which to remedy the default. You may avoid termination by curing the default to our satisfaction within the 10-day period (or such longer period as applicable law may require). If you do not cure the default within such 10-day period (or such longer period as applicable law may require), this Agreement will terminate automatically and without further notice, effective immediately upon the expiration of the specified time period.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Page 30 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015
15.3. Termination by Us Following Expiration of Cure Period for Monetary Default . In the event that we are unable to collect payments via electronic fund transfer as per Section 3.6 [Method of Payment] due to reasons such as insufficient funds in your account(s), closure of your account(s), or any other circumstance leading to nonpayment, you will be deemed in breach of this Agreement regarding monies owed to us, our affiliates, lenders providing financing under this Agreement or any other agreement, and your landlord and/or suppliers of goods or services for your Franchised Business. Upon receipt of written notice from us, you will have a grace period of ten (10) days to rectify the breach. If you successfully remedy the issue within this timeframe (or any extended duration as required by law), termination may be avoided. However, should you fail to resolve the matter within the stated or legally mandated time, this Agreement shall automatically terminate without prior notification, becoming effective immediately upon the lapse of the specified time period.

original: 16.2. Purchase of Assets. You agree that, at our option, you will sell to us any or all your assets used to operate the Franchised Business (including equipment, fixtures, furnishings, Delivery Vehicles, supplies, and inventory) that we ask in writing to purchase.
ollama_generated: 16.2. Acquisition of Assets. Grantee acknowledges and consents to the possibility, at our discretion, for us to acquire any or all assets belonging to them, which have been utilized for the operation of the Franchised Business (comprising equipment, fixtures, furnishings, Delivery Vehicles, supplies, inventory, etc.), upon written request by us. The onus shall be on us to arrange and finalize the purchase, while Grantee is obligated to cooperate in good faith for a smooth transition of ownership.

original: 16.2.4. If we do not exercise our rights to purchase your Delivery Vehicle(s), you must immediately make such modifications or alterations to the Delivery Vehicle(s) that may be needed to remove any Proprietary Marks and to otherwise distinguish the appearance of the vehicle(s) from those used by other Restaurants.
ollama_generated: 16.2.4. In the event we decide not to acquire your Delivery Vehicles, it shall be your responsibility to ensure that any necessary modifications or alterations are made to the vehicles within a reasonable timeframe, for the purpose of removing any Proprietary Marks and establishing visual differences between the vehicles and those used by other Restaurants. This obligation will persist post-transfer, unless otherwise agreed in writing.

original: 24. GOVERNING LAW This Agreement and the relationship between the parties is governed by and will be construed exclusively in accordance with the laws of the State of Florida  (without regard to, and without applying, Florida conflict-of-law rules).
modified:
24. APPLICABLE LAW
This Agreement shall be subject to and interpreted solely under the jurisdiction of Florida's legal system, adhering strictly to its substantive laws, disregarding any Florida conflict-of-law principles that may otherwise apply.

original: 25.7. Remedies Not Exclusive . Except as provided in Sections 25.1  [Submission to Mediation]  through  25.4  [Mutual Waiver of Jury Trial]  above, no right or remedy that the parties have under this Agreement is exclusive of any other right or remedy under this Agreement or under applicable law.
ollama_generated: 25.7. Multiple Remedies Permitted . Except as specified in Sections 25.1 [Submission to Mediation] through 25.4 [Mutual Waiver of Jury Trial], the parties acknowledge and agree that they may exercise any right or remedy, either under this Agreement or applicable law, concurrently with any other available rights or remedies under this Agreement or law. The availability of one remedy does not preclude the use of another.

original: Page 37 of 39 Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015 26.1.5 You have sole and complete responsibility for the choice of the Premises; that we have not (and will not be deemed to have, even by virtue of our approval of the proposed Premises) given any representation, promise, or guarantee of your success at the Premises; and that you will be solely responsible for its own success at the Premises.
ollama_generated: 26.1.5 It is understood that the selection of the Premises lies entirely with you, without any representation, assurance, or warranty being made by us regarding your potential success at the Premises. Conversely, we disclaim any implied promises or guarantees about your business performance at the Premises, and you shall bear the sole responsibility for its success or failure.

original: Franchisee By: By:
modified:
Franchisee Shall Not: Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Franchisee shall have no obligation to:

1. Pursue any specific marketing strategies or campaigns as prescribed by the Franchisor. The Franchisee may use its own discretion in developing and implementing marketing plans for the operation of the franchise business, subject to the Franchisor's approval.
2. Provide regular updates on the day-to-day operations of the franchise business to the Franchisor unless specifically requested by the Franchisor or required under applicable law.
3. Maintain the franchise premises in a state of good repair and cleanliness, except for any damage caused intentionally by the Franchisee or its employees. The Franchisor shall be responsible for providing maintenance and repair services, subject to the terms of this agreement.
4. Train new hires on all aspects of the franchise business unless otherwise agreed upon between the parties in writing. In such cases, the Franchisee may delegate training responsibilities to designated employees or third-party trainers, subject to the Franchisor's approval.

original: Source: PF HOSPITALITY GROUP INC., 10-12G, 9/23/2015
modified:
Clause (Revised):

Source: REDEFINED LODGING CORPORATION, 17-14A, DATE OF EFFECT: MARCH 1ST, 2016

The Lessee shall, under normal circumstances and at the Lessee's sole discretion, make every reasonable effort to maintain the Premises in a clean, safe, and orderly condition; provided, however, that any damages or losses caused by unforeseen circumstances beyond the control of the Lessee, such as acts of God, public enemies, or other similar events, shall not be considered breaches of this Lease Agreement. The Lessor accepts no responsibility for any such damages or losses and agrees to indemnify the Lessee from any claims arising therefrom.
